sources.title: The Party (1968) Peter Sellers Â· Claudine Longet
sources.description: A gentle but clumsy Indian film extra, who magically attracts disasters, accidentally stumbles into a Hollywood producer's party and unintentionally transforms his villa into a madhouse

metadata.Plot: By a twist of fate, the clumsy, but well-meaning aspiring actor, Hrundi V. Bakshi, is invited to Fred Clutterbuck's big party, after utterly ruining the set of his latest feature film. However, unbeknownst to the host, Bakshi is present at the gathering, merrily mingling with the hand-picked guests in this magnificent hi-tech villa, where the drinks are flowing, and everybody is in high spirits. But, much to everyone's surprise, when Bakshi accidentally has his first-ever sip of alcohol, only God knows how this well-thought party will end. What delightful disasters await?
metadata.Writer: Blake Edwards, Tom Waldman, Frank Waldman
metadata.Actors: Peter Sellers, Claudine Longet, Natalia Borisova
